instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.KERNEL_TASK: What is KERNEL_TASK? KERNEL_TASK is a process that will take up all the CPU and cause the macbook to run very slow when there is a sensor issue. When you see KERNEL_TASK as a process taking up lots of CPU and the machine is working very slow or has loud fans, use a program like hwmonitor to check voltage, amperage, and temperature sensors and look for something that doesnâ€™t look right..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A (Retina 2015) Running Slow
threads.message:
Hey,

I got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A motherboard with possibly some liquid damage and just did a Bios ME Region clean (since it had an EFI lock in it). Battery charges and it runs off battery so I was happy, but now I am running into a new issue.

The system is running very slow and <SIGNAL>KERNEL_TASK</SIGNAL> is using up majority of the CPU. When I run ASD it gives the codes PFM006, and PPN001. I installed iStat and found the Left Fin Stack sensor and air flow proximity sensor area reading as empty.

Could you please point me what I should check for? I am out of ideas on what to test since ASD isn't giving useful information. I already checked <SIGNAL>I2C_CPUTHMSNS_SDA</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>I2C_CPUTHMSNS_SCL</SIGNAL> don't have a short to ground, and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0_CPUTHMSNS_R</SIGNAL> is getting 3.3v.

I also can't find where the Th1H sensor is located on the motherboard with the schematic.


Thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A (Retina 2015) Running Slow
threads.message: There is no need to mess with ME region if EFI lock, use original ME......

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A (Retina 2015) Running Slow
threads.message: Sorry I meant I cleared the part part between the $SVS tags, I thought that was the ME region. I didn't touch anything else.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A (Retina 2015) Running Slow
threads.message: Fixed! One of the resistors (<RESISTOR>R5875</RESISTOR>) near the right fin stack on the schematic was loose and fell off. Soldered it back on and it works again :)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A (Retina 2015) Running Slow
threads.message: What did you do to the ME? The methods posted that you find with Google are totally wrong!
